title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Rise for Fourth Day, Pound Stays Above $1.35
Apollo Sees Opportunities in Investment-Grade Credit
content: Apollo Global Management President Jim Zelter discusses private markets and why he sees opportunities in investment-grade credit. He talks with Bloomberg's Kriti Gupta at the SuperReturn Conference in Berlin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Korean Stocks Rise to Enter Bull Market, Bonds Sink After Vote
content: South Korea’s equity benchmark climbed to enter a bull market, after Lee Jae-myung’s widely-expected win in the presidential election ended a months-long political leadership vacuum.

title: Norway Seafood Exports Snap 10-Month Streak on Salmon Retreat
content: A slump in salmon prices in May contributed to the first annual drop in Norwegian seafood exports after 10 months of growth as production of the pink-fleshed fish rose.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 6/4/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump to Attend NATO Summit Later This Month
content: Donald Trump will attend the upcoming NATO summit in The Hague, Netherlands, the White House said, as the US president seeks to rally the alliance’s members to step up defense spending to 5% of GDP. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.

title: Bankers, Economists Vie for Governor’s Role at Bank of Thailand
content: The race to be Bank of Thailand governor is heating up, with multiple bankers and economists applying ahead of Wednesday’s deadline for a pivotal role in Southeast Asia’s second-biggest economy.

title: Stocks, European Futures Rise on US Jobs Surprise: Markets Wrap
content: Asian stocks rose for the first time in four days after data showed the US labor market is holding up, easing concerns President Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing the world economy into a downturn.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/04/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gower: Aluminum Tariff Hike Unlikely to Impact US Short-Term Imports
content: President Trump has signed a directive, doubling steel and aluminum tariffs to 50-percent, with the higher levies coming into force on Wednesday. Morgan Stanley Metals and Mining Commodities Strategist Amy Gower spoke to Joumanna Bercetche on Horizons Middle East and Africa, and says the higher tariff is unlikely to impact US imports in the short term. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trivium China Sees Beijing With Rare Earths Advantage
content: As tensions rise between the US and China, one of the main sticking points looks to be around the issue of rare earths. And Trivium China says Beijing still has significant leverage when it comes to the critical minerals. Cory Combs, Head of Critical Mineral and Supply Chain Research made the comments during "Bloomberg's The China Show." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/4/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Miniso Is Said to Hire JPMorgan, UBS for Top Toy’s Hong Kong IPO
content: Miniso Group Holding Ltd. has hired JPMorgan Chase & Co. and UBS Group AG for the planned initial public offering of unit Top Toy in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the development.

title: South Korea’s Lee Kicks Off Presidency
content: South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung took office with a pledge to revive the nation’s tariff-hit economy and seek dialogue with North Korea to diffuse tensions on the Korean Peninsula. Bloomberg TV's Shery Ahn speaks on Insight with Haslinda Amin about the newly elected leader. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Action in Hong Kong Equity Markets Stirs Most Excitement in Years
content: Hong Kong’s equity capital markets are seeing the most action in years, with multibillion dollar deals lifting the mood and fueling anticipation about more transactions to come.

title: Oil Steadies With Focus on Canada Wildfires, US Crude Stockpiles
content: Oil steadied after a two-day gain as rains slowed the growth of some blazes which had disrupted Canadian crude production.

title: Toyota Industries Shares Slide on Buyout Discount Blowback
content: Toyota Industries Corp. shares fell the most in nine months after the Toyota group unveiled a ¥4.7 trillion ($33 billion) plan to privatize Toyota Industries Corp., drawing sharp criticism from investors and analysts who say the proposal significantly undervalues the company.

title: Lagarde’s ECB Future Set for Scrutiny After WEF Job Speculation
content: Christine Lagarde is about to face scrutiny on her commitment to keep leading the European Central Bank, not least as she nears the milestone of having just about tamed inflation.

title: Poland to Hold Rates, Focus on Glapinski’s Tone
content: Poland is set to keep interest rates on hold, with investors focusing on central bank Governor Adam Glapinski’s outlook for borrowing costs following a pivotal presidential election.

title: Former S.Korean Trade Minister Yeo on Trade Outlook
content: Han-koo Yeo, Peterson Institute for International Economics Senior Fellow and Former South Korean Trade Minister, discusses the economic and trade outlook for the country after South Koreans elected Lee Jae-myung as their new President, following months of political turmoil after a martial law declaration late 2024. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Paul Allen on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China Consumers Get Thrifty During Holidays as Spending Stumbles
content: Chinese consumer spending faltered during a major holiday even as more people hit the road, suggesting a trade truce with the US is failing to turn around sentiment in an economy reeling from Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: China Bond Futures Trade Dwindles as Market Awaits Xi-Trump Call
content: Transactions in China’s long-term sovereign bond futures are cooling as traders hold off making bets in the market given continued tariff disputes with the US.

title: Vietnam Orders Action to Avert Power Crunch as Heat Lifts Demand
content: Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has ordered government agencies to ensure uninterrupted power supplies for households and businesses as heat waves boost electricity demand to a record.

title: Gold Edges Up on Dip-Buying, Persistent Trade War Worries
content: Gold edged higher after falling in the previous session, buoyed by Asian bargain-hunters as concerns resurfaced over the impact of US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 6/4/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Seoul and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Paul Allen, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Iran Oil Flows to China Fall on Sanctions, Refinery Maintenance
content: Iran is shipping less oil to China, as toughening sanctions snarl the OPEC producer’s shipments and refinery demand falls in the world’s biggest fossil fuel importer.

title: Overweight US and Asia Equities, HSBC’s Sels Says
content: Willem Sels, Global CIO at HSBC Global Private Banking & Premier Wealth, says “we’re rebuilding our equity exposure with overweights in the US and in Asia.” Sels also discusses his outlook for the US economy and opportunities in fixed income. He speaks on Bloomberg Television.

title: Indian Stocks Bullish Momentum Takes a Pause
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Petronas Is Said to Weigh Sale of $7 Billion Canada Business
content: Petroliam Nasional Bhd. is considering options for its Canadian company formerly known as Progress Energy Resources Corp., including a sale, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: China’s Wheat Harvest Risks 7-Year Low as Farmers Battle Drought
content: China’s wheat output could drop as much as 5% this year to the lowest since 2018, after recent drought in key growing regions stressed the crop.

title: Iran’s Khamenei Spurns ‘Arrogant’ US Nuclear-Deal Proposal
content: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei criticized a US proposal for a nuclear deal and called American officials “arrogant” for expecting the Islamic Republic to cease uranium enrichment.

title: Korean Stocks Rise to Enter Bull Market, Bonds Sink After Vote
content: South Korea’s equity benchmark climbed to enter a bull market, after Lee Jae-myung’s widely-expected win in the presidential election ended a months-long political leadership vacuum.

title: Trump Gives UK Five-Week Deadline After Reprieve on Steel Tariff
content: The UK is contending with a new five-week deadline to finalize its trade agreement with the US after President Donald Trump spared the country’s steel and aluminum exports from a doubling of existing tariffs.

title: Korean Air Chairman Calls for Stability, Tariff Cuts
content: South Korea’s next government should prioritize making a trade deal with Washington that shields the aviation industry from tariffs, the head of the country’s largest airline said.

title: Trump Says China’s Xi Is ‘Extremely Hard to Make a Deal With’
content: President Donald Trump in a late-night social media post called Xi Jinping very tough to make a deal with, dimming the prospect of an immediate call between the two men.

title: Netherlands Faces Months in Limbo After Government Collapses
content: The Netherlands faces months of uncertainty after far-right politician Geert Wilders pulled the plug on the coalition, toppling the government.

title: Tariffs, North Korea Cast Shadow Over Lee’s First Day in Office
content: South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung took office with a pledge to revive a national economy threatened by Donald Trump’s tariffs just as the US president doubled duties on steel and aluminum, highlighting the pressing challenges facing the Asian leader.

title: Democrats Lose Challenge to Trump’s Order on Election Commission
content: The Democratic Party’s governing body lost its legal challenge to an executive order by President Donald Trump that it said would eliminate the bipartisan nature of the Federal Elections Commission and shift authority to the White House.

title: Trump Signs Order Doubling US Steel, Aluminum Tariffs to 50%
content: President Donald Trump has raised steel and aluminum tariffs to 50% from 25%, following through on a pledge to boost US import taxes to help domestic manufacturers.

title: Merz Has Courted and Criticized Trump From Afar. Now They Meet
content: After weeks of preparation, the new German chancellor faces his biggest test yet.

title: UK Confronts Hard Reality of Rebuilding Its Military Prowess
content: Years of underinvestment, botched contracts and poor recruitment have hollowed out what was once a superpower.

title: Pentagon Wants to Delay Navy’s Next-Gen Fighter to Focus on F-47
content: The Pentagon wants to give priority to the Air Force’s F-47 stealth fighter over Navy plans to develop its own next-generation jet, arguing that pursuing the two programs at the same time could delay them both.

title: Lagarde’s ECB Future Set for Scrutiny After WEF Job Speculation
content: Christine Lagarde is about to face scrutiny on her commitment to keep leading the European Central Bank, not least as she nears the milestone of having just about tamed inflation.

title: Philippine Vice President Duterte Questions Impeachment Trial Under New Congress
content: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte has questioned whether her impeachment trial on charges that include a suspected plot to assassinate President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. can go forward when a new set of lawmakers takes office next month.

title: Rubio Eulogizes Tiananmen Protesters as Tariffs Test Ties
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio praised pro-democracy protesters who were killed in Beijing’s bloody Tiananmen Square crackdown 36 years ago, carrying on Washington’s criticism of China’s human rights record as tariff disputes further test already frayed ties.

title: University of Florida President Pick Santa Ono Rejected After Republican DEI Backlash
content: Florida state university leaders voted to reject Santo Ono as president of the University of Florida, following Republican backlash over the former University of Michigan president’s previous support for diversity programs.

title: Mexico Will Ask US Government for Steel Tariff Exemption
content: Mexico will ask Donald Trump’s administration this week to be exempted from an increase in steel tariffs to 50%, the country’s economy minister said on Tuesday.

title: South Korea Elects Lee President, Capping Six Months of Chaos
content: Left-leaning challenger Lee Jae-myung won South Korea’s presidential election, ending three years of conservative rule in a race that was largely a verdict on his ousted predecessor’s botched attempt to revive martial law in the longstanding US ally.

title: Trump Taps Former Small Business Chief for Role Overseeing CFIUS
content: President Donald Trump has nominated Chris Pilkerton, the acting head of the Small Business Administration during his first term, to oversee a committee charged with screening foreign investments into the US as well as outbound investments in foreign countries, with a close eye on competition with China.

title: House SALT Deal Will Have to Change, Senate Leader Thune Says
content: Senate Majority Leader John Thune believes the deal that led the US House to increase the maximum deduction for state and local taxes to $40,000 will have to be changed in his chamber, according to his office.

title: Walmart Cuts Some Florida Jobs After Immigration Rulings
content: Walmart Inc. is terminating some jobs in Florida after recent Supreme Court rulings about the legal residency of migrants, the latest sign that such orders are hitting US workplaces.

title: China’s Top Diplomat Urges US to Put Relations on ‘Right Track’
content: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi used his first meeting with new US Ambassador David Perdue to complain about recent actions by Washington, underscoring a downturn in relations between the world’s two biggest economies.

title: Penn Wins Dismissal of Antisemitism Suit by Jewish Students
content: A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit against University of Pennsylvania filed by Jewish students over antisemitism, ruling they failed to show the Ivy League school engaged in intentional discrimination.

title: UK Could Miss 2030 Clean Power Goal, Parliament Committee Warns
content: The UK’s goal of a clean power grid by 2030 is in danger of slipping out of reach as planning delays and infrastructure bottlenecks challenge the government.

title: Reeves Fights Back Against Cuts Narrative With UK Building Blitz
content: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will detail hundreds of billions of pounds worth of projects to fix Britain’s creaking infrastructure during next week’s spending review, a crunch moment for Keir Starmer’s administration as it struggles to regain momentum after a faltering first year in power.

title: Outspoken South Korea Leftist Survived Stabbing on Path to Power
content: Lee Jae-myung, the tenacious left-leaning maverick who became South Korea’s new president Wednesday, has spent a lifetime picking himself off the canvas to fight again.

title: Trump Revokes Biden-Era Rule on Emergency Abortions in Hospitals
content: The Trump administration rescinded guidance put in place by former President Joe Biden that directed US hospitals to provide abortions on an emergency basis when they’re medically necessary to stabilize patients.

title: US Farm Sentiment at 4-Year High as Trump Seeks Trade Deals
content: American farmer sentiment jumped to a four-year high, with growers betting on rising crop exports as the Trump administration pushes for more trade deals from Vietnam to Italy.

title: Mexico Vote for Top Court Shows Majority With Morena Ties
content: Mexico’s new Supreme Court will feature a clear majority of justices with direct ties to the country’s former leftist president or the ruling Morena party he founded, according to preliminary election results with nearly all votes counted.

title: Trump Asks Congress to Slash Funds for NPR, PBS and Foreign Aid
content: President Donald Trump asked lawmakers to cut more than $9 billion in funding for the Public Broadcasting Service, National Public Radio and foreign aid from this year’s budget, an attempt to write into law some of the so-called “DOGE cuts” initiated by Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency.

title: Remy Cointreau Pulls Sales Targets Over Tariff Challenges
content: Remy Cointreau SA withdrew its long-term sales guidance, blaming tariff policies in America and China and a stunted recovery in the US market.

title: Korean Air Chairman Calls for Stability, Tariff Cuts
content: South Korea’s next government should prioritize making a trade deal with Washington that shields the aviation industry from tariffs, the head of the country’s largest airline said.

title: Can the UK Rebuild Its Military Prowess?
content: The UK has fallen behind Germany as the second-biggest European spender in NATO, its army is at its smallest size since the Napoleonic era and British armed forces are losing more people than they’re recruiting. The government’s latest defense review set out plans to rebuild stockpiles, expand the nation’s nuclear deterrence and submarine fleet as well as invest more heavily in long-range weapons and advanced tech like drones and lasers. Bloomberg’s Caroline Hepker reports.

title: Elon Musk Lambasts Trump’s Tax Bill as an ‘Abomination’
content: Good morning. Elon Musk blasts Donald Trump’s tax bill. The UK scores an exemption from higher metal tariffs. And while there are more millionaires globally, there are fewer in Europe. Listen to the day’s top stories.

A day earlier, President Donald Trump signed a directive formally doubling steel and aluminum tariffs to 50%. title: EngineAI Targets $1 Billion Valuation: Co-founder Ren
content: Chinese startup EngineAI is planning a new round of financing later this year, targeting a $1 billion valuation as it seeks to join the global race to develop humanoid robots. Speaking with Bloomberg TV's Annabelle Droulers, Co-founder Ren Guowen discussed the latest capabilities of EngineAI’s humanoid robots, current production progress, fundraising plans, and the impact of US-China tensions. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Former Meitu Chairman on Bitcoin & AI Outlook
content:
Mike Cai, former Chairman of Chinese Photo Editing app, Meitu, and angel investor that focuses on Web 3 & digital assets, says bitcoin can hit 1.1M USD within a decade. 
He sees application layer as the next frontier in AI, instead of large language models (LLMs), for competition in technological advancements globally. He talks about his plans to set up an AI focused hub for startups and entrepreneurs in Hong Kong. He speaks with Annabelle Droulers at BEYOND Expo in Macau. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: CDL to Sell $2.1 Billion Singapore Office Site to Cut Debt
content: City Developments Ltd. agreed to sell its majority stake in one of Singapore’s most iconic office complexes, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the developer seeks to reduce debt and regain investor confidence after a family feud.

Senator Tina Smith (D) Minnesota discusses her opposition to the Tax Bill stating costs will go up for most Americans if the legislation is passed. title: Gen. Clark on European Union Push for Air Defenses
content: Retired General Wesley Clark, Former NATO Supreme Allied Commander Europe, discusses NATO pushing the European Union to boost air defenses and how quickly this could happen. He also shares his reaction to the notion that warfare is changing, reflecting on the Ukraine drone strike on Russia. Retired General Wesley Clark speaks with Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg’s “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI Upstart Manus Starts Text-to-Video Service to Take On OpenAI
content: Manus unveiled a text-to-video generation feature, entering a competitive segment populated by rivals from OpenAI to China’s Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Tencent Holdings Ltd.

title: CrowdStrike Shares Plunge After Sales Forecast Underwhelms
content: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. shares fell after the cybersecurity company projected revenue for the current quarter that trailed estimates.

title: Ex-Tesla Executive Signs Letter of Intent with Stargate’s Crusoe
content: A startup founded by former Tesla Inc. executive Drew Baglino has signed letters of intent to sell technology designed to address the AI boom’s biggest bottlenecks: aging infrastructure and a transformer shortage.

title: Capital Group, Kushner’s Thrive Visited China to Study AI Scene
content: Joshua Kushner’s Thrive Capital and investment firm Capital Group have in recent months visited China to learn about its AI industry, joining a growing number of US investors rekindling interest in the country after DeepSeek’s advances stunned Silicon Valley.

title: TSMC Flags Delays in Japan Expansion While US Plans Advance
content: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Chief Executive Officer C. C. Wei blamed worsening traffic snarls for delays in expanding its base in southwestern Japan, even while a parallel US effort races ahead.

title: Software Error Forces MIAX Sapphire Exchange to Bust Trades
content: Exchange operator Miami International Holdings, Inc. had an operational snafu on Tuesday causing one of its four options exchanges to shut down and forcing transactions to be torn up.

title: Nintendo Can’t Afford a Slip Up With Switch 2
content: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: Can Nintendo continue to thrill gamers with a pricey new console and games to match.

title: Meta Turns to Nuclear Power to Run AI | Bloomberg Technology 6/3/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Meta’s plans to buy nuclear power from Constellation Energy. Plus xAI is selling $5 billion in debt, the latest in a series of fundraising efforts across Elon Musk’s business empire. And former Tesla executive Drew Baglino talks about his new startup Heron Power, aiming to upend the transformer industry.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: HPE Posts Strong Revenue Growth, Sees Reduced Tariff Impact
content: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. reported quarterly revenue that topped estimates and said it expects a reduced impact from tariffs on its business this year.

title: Robinhood Shares Ride Crypto Boom Back to Record Highs
content: Nearly four years after its much-hyped debut, Robinhood Markets Inc. has finally seen its shares hit a fresh record as cryptocurrency markets rally.

title: Climate Investor Energize Raises $430 Million for New VC Fund
content: The climate tech investment firm Energize Capital has raised $430 million for a new fund targeting early-stage startups working on projects like new batteries and software for the electric grid.

title: Marathon’s Richards Raises Caution on Direct Lending to Software Firms
content: Handing out private loans to software technology companies is not “intelligent,” said Marathon Asset Management Chief Executive Officer and founder Bruce Richards.

title: Mark Zuckerberg’s AI Slop Will Make Ads Creepier and Worse
content: As Meta grabs for more control over how companies talk to customers, the rest of us may be left flooded in more algorithmic mediocrity.

title: Microsoft Cuts Hundreds of Jobs After Firing 6,000 in May
content: Microsoft Corp. cut hundreds more jobs just weeks after its largest layoff in years, underscoring the tech industry’s efforts to trim costs even as it plows billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.

title: Meta’s Deal for Nuclear Power Is Likely Cheaper Than Microsoft’s, Jefferies Says
content: Surging demand for power to run artificial intelligence just prompted Meta Platforms Inc. to enter a 20-year contract with the biggest US nuclear operator, penning a deal that’s likely to be priced at a cheaper rate than a similar agreement rival Microsoft Corp. entered last year.

title: Kuwait Wealth Fund Joins Microsoft, MGX’s $30 Billion AI Venture
content: Kuwait’s sovereign wealth fund is joining a Microsoft Corp.-backed initiative to bankroll $30 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure globally, as the oil-rich Gulf nation looks to tap into the booming sector.

title: Broadcom Ships New Gear Meant to Improve AI Chip Performance
content: Data center switch will let customers get more from their Nvidia processors

title: Chinese EV Maker Nio to Reduce R&D Costs to Hit Break-Even Goal
content: Nio Inc. aims to reduce research and development spending by as much as 25% as it seeks to reach its break-even target by the fourth quarter.

title: Musk’s X Aims to Soothe EU Regulators With Blue Check Disclaimer
content: Elon Musk’s social network X is showing users a prominent disclaimer about the platform’s blue checkmark program in a bid to appease concerns from the European Union’s content regulators that it’s deceptive and should be overhauled.

title: Meta to Buy Nuclear Power From Constellation as AI Demand Soars
content: Constellation Energy Corp. agreed to sell power from an Illinois nuclear plant to Meta Platforms Inc. as artificial intelligence sends power demand soaring.

title: Victoria’s Secret Says Security Incident That Shut Down Website May Hurt Results
content: Victoria’s Secret & Co. said a security incident that caused it to shut down its e-commerce site may hurt results for the current quarter.

title: Prosus President and Chief Investment Officer Tu to Resign
content: Prosus NV’s President and Chief Investment Officer Ervin Tu will step down from his role after a nearly four-year tenure during which the South African-Dutch tech investment company restructured itself and appointed a new chief executive officer.

title: Cracking the Code of Making Old Clothes New Again
content: Discarded clothing is an environmental scourge. But across Europe, companies are joining forces to build new technologies that could make recycling scalable.

title: Huawei’s Pura X Is An Intriguing New Foldable — If You’re Outside the US
content: Review: The clamshell device is the company’s first flagship phone to launch with its new operating system to challenge iOS and Android.

title: Former Key SpaceX Engineer’s Impulse Space Raises $300 Million
content: Impulse Space raised $300 million in its latest funding round as the US-based startup looks to cash in on demand for its highly agile spacecraft.

title: Ex-Lebanese PM Sets Up Abu Dhabi Investment Firm Targeting AI
content: Former Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Hariri is launching an investment firm in Abu Dhabi, deepening his ties to the capital of the United Arab Emirates.

title: China’s Manus Shows the Promise of AI Agents: Review
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Newley Purnell tests out the Manus AI agent.

title: AI Drug Startup Touts Promising Advance in Treating Lung Disease
content: A drug developed using artificial intelligence showed signs of efficacy in treating an incurable lung disease in what its developer calls a clinical first.

title: Xiaomi Founder Expects EV Arm to Turn Profitable After New SUV
content: Xiaomi Corp. founder Lei Jun expects its year-old EV business to turn profitable in the second half, a milestone for the billionaire’s $10 billion endeavor in a cut-throat market.

title: AI Pioneer Launches Research Group to Help Build Safer Agents
content: Yoshua Bengio, an artificial intelligence pioneer, is creating a new nonprofit research organization to promote an alternative approach to developing cutting-edge AI systems, with the aim of mitigating the technology’s potential risks. The nonprofit, called LawZero, is set to launch Tuesday with $30 million in backing from one of former Google Chief Executive Officer Eric Schmidt’s philanthropic organizations and Skype co-founder Jaan Tallinn, among others. Bengio will lead a team of more than 1

title: Putin’s War Economy Roars Ahead and the Rest of Russia Struggles
content: The rift in Russia’s two-track economy is becoming wider as businesses tied to President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine thrive and the rest are struggling for resources.

title: Trump Gives UK Five-Week Deadline After Reprieve on Steel Tariff
content: The UK is contending with a new five-week deadline to finalize its trade agreement with the US after President Donald Trump spared the country’s steel and aluminum exports from a doubling of existing tariffs.

title: Tariffs, North Korea Cast Shadow Over Lee’s First Day in Office
content: South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung took office with a pledge to revive a national economy threatened by Donald Trump’s tariffs just as the US president doubled duties on steel and aluminum, highlighting the pressing challenges facing the Asian leader.

title: Japan's Annual Births Fall Below 700,000 for the First Time
content: Japan’s fertility rate declined in 2024 for the ninth consecutive year, reaching another historical low that underscores the immense challenge facing the government as it attempts to reverse the trend in one of the world’s most aged societies.

title: Trump and Xi Views on Rare Earths Deal Differ, Trade Expert Says
content: The US and China appear to have different understandings of what was agreed on rare earths at last month’s trade talks in Geneva, according to an expert on critical minerals policy.

content: President Donald Trump has raised steel and aluminum tariffs to 50% from 25%, following through on a pledge to boost US import taxes to help domestic manufacturers.

title: Lagarde’s ECB Future Set for Scrutiny After WEF Job Speculation
content: Christine Lagarde is about to face scrutiny on her commitment to keep leading the European Central Bank, not least as she nears the milestone of having just about tamed inflation.

title: Poland to Hold Rates, Focus on Glapinski’s Tone
content: Poland is set to keep interest rates on hold, with investors focusing on central bank Governor Adam Glapinski’s outlook for borrowing costs following a pivotal presidential election.

title: Vietnam Orders Action to Avert Power Crunch as Heat Lifts Demand
content: Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has ordered government agencies to ensure uninterrupted power supplies for households and businesses as heat waves boost electricity demand to a record.

title: Australia’s Soft Economy Bolsters Case for Further Rate Cuts
content: Australia’s economy opened 2025 on a softer-than-expected note as both public demand and exports detracted from growth, reinforcing the case for the Reserve Bank to act on its dovish stance and ease policy further.

title: Mexico Will Ask US Government for Steel Tariff Exemption
content: Mexico will ask Donald Trump’s administration this week to be exempted from an increase in steel tariffs to 50%, the country’s economy minister said on Tuesday.

title: South Korea Elects Lee President, Capping Six Months of Chaos
content: Left-leaning challenger Lee Jae-myung won South Korea’s presidential election, ending three years of conservative rule in a race that was largely a verdict on his ousted predecessor’s botched attempt to revive martial law in the longstanding US ally.

title: China’s Top Diplomat Urges US to Put Relations on ‘Right Track’
content: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi used his first meeting with new US Ambassador David Perdue to complain about recent actions by Washington, underscoring a downturn in relations between the world’s two biggest economies.

title: US Farm Sentiment at 4-Year High as Trump Seeks Trade Deals
content: American farmer sentiment jumped to a four-year high, with growers betting on rising crop exports as the Trump administration pushes for more trade deals from Vietnam to Italy.

title: Bank of Canada Likely to Hold as Uncertainty Mounts: Decision Guide
content: The Bank of Canada is likely to hold interest rates steady as officials wait for clearer signals on how US President Donald Trump’s trade war will end up striking the economy.

title: Traders Load Up on Hedges Against Dramatic Fed Rate Cut Shifts
content: Traders are ramping up bets that hedge against dramatic shifts in the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path as questions on the economic impact of Trump’s administration evolving policies persist.

title: Bureau of Labor Statistics to Correct ‘Minor Errors’ in April’s US Jobs Data
content: The Bureau of Labor Statistics said it will correct “minor errors” in April jobs data on Friday with the release of figures for May, adding the changes won’t affect key measures such as the unemployment rate.

title: UK Rushes to Save US Steel Tariff Deal Before Levies Double
content: The UK is pushing the US to remove tariffs on British steel exports in line with a deal struck last month, ahead of a planned blanket doubling of levies.

title: Elon Musk Blasts Trump Tax Bill as Budget-Busting ‘Abomination’
content: Donald Trump ally Elon Musk lambasted the president’s signature tax bill as a budget-busting “abomination” as Republican fiscal hawks stepped up criticism of the massive fiscal package.

title: Fed’s Cook Underscores Importance of Price Stability
content: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said she sees tariffs as potentially stoking inflation and weakening employment, yet underscored the importance of price stability when considering future interest-rate adjustments.

title: US Sent Letters to Trade Partners Ahead of Tariff Deadline
content: The Office of the US Trade Representative has sent letters to trading partners to remind them of an upcoming deadline in tariff negotiations, according to the White House, an effort by the Trump administration to push forward talks.

title: South Africa Central Bank Sees ‘Amazing’ Chance to Lower CPI Goal
content: South Africa’s current low level of inflation is an unmissable chance to reduce the country’s inflation target and lock in the benefits of tame price pressures and cheaper borrowing costs.

title: SNB’s Tschudin Says Monthly Inflation Number Just One Data Point
content: The Swiss National Bank won’t be distracted by monthly inflation numbers, according to a senior official.

title: Fed’s Bostic Wants More Progress on Inflation, in No Rush to Cut
content: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said he’s in no rush to move interest rates, adding he wants to see “a lot” more progress on inflation despite recent encouraging price data.

title: NY Fed Says Net Income Could Be Negative Through Most of 2025
content: Total net income from the Federal Reserve’s System Open Market Account could remain negative on an annual basis in 2025 before returning to positive levels as early as next year, according to new projections from the New York Fed.

title: Carney’s Budget Delay Adds to Economic Uncertainty in Canada, Analysts Say
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s decision to delay Canada’s budget until later this year increases economic uncertainty but isn’t likely to spark worries among investors, say a majority of economists in a Bloomberg survey.

title: France Says Positive Outcome Possible in Cognac Probe Talks With China
content: France’s trade minister said he believes Beijing and Paris can resolve a spat over duties on Cognac that is hammering French producers and complicating broader discussions on global commerce.

title: US Job Openings Unexpectedly Rose in April and Hiring Picked Up
content: US job openings unexpectedly rose in April in a fairly broad advance and hiring picked up, indicating demand for workers remains healthy despite heightened economic uncertainty.

title: Dutch Government Crisis Risks Slowing EU Decisions, ING CEO Says
content: The collapse of the Dutch government risks slowing decisions related to Europe’s planned investment spree, said ING Groep NV Chief Executive Officer Steven van Rijswijk.

title: BOE Officials Defend Diverging Views With Inflation Path Unclear
content: Bank of England rate-setters defended their wide range of views on the direction of monetary policy as they laid out to lawmakers starkly different opinions on the outlook for inflation.

title: China Weighs Ordering Hundreds of Airbus Jets in Major Deal
content: China is considering placing an order for hundreds of Airbus SE aircraft as soon as next month, when European leaders visit Beijing to celebrate the countries’ long-term ties, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Japan’s Top Banks Consider Teaming Up on ATMs to Cut Costs
content: MUFG Bank Ltd., Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. and Mizuho Bank Ltd. are considering jointly operating automated teller machines to reduce costs, said people familiar with the matter.

title: New Zealand All Blacks Rugby Team Sign Gallagher Insurance as Sponsor
content: New Zealand Rugby agreed a sponsorship deal with Gallagher Insurance that will give the US-based insurance brokerage naming rights on the playing kit of the All Blacks rugby team.

title: Global Carriers Pile On India Capacity as US-Europe Traffic Drops
content: The skies above India are about to get a lot busier as international carriers add more routes to the world’s most-populated nation to make up for tepid transatlantic demand that’s come under pressure from global economic uncertainties.

title: Mexico Will Ask US Government for Steel Tariff Exemption
content: Mexico will ask Donald Trump’s administration this week to be exempted from an increase in steel tariffs to 50%, the country’s economy minister said on Tuesday.

title: Virgin Australia IPO Seeks $443 Million as Bain Rides Rally
content: Bain Capital-controlled airline Virgin Australia will relist in a A$685 million ($443 million) initial public offering, betting investors are brushing off the turmoil caused by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Walmart Cuts Some Florida Jobs After Immigration Rulings
content: Walmart Inc. is terminating some jobs in Florida after recent Supreme Court rulings about the legal residency of migrants, the latest sign that such orders are hitting US workplaces.

title: China’s Air Pollution Problem Is Following Industries West: CREA
content: China’s push to move heavy industry into its western regions is hurting air quality there even as it improves for the nation as a whole, according to a new report from the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air.

title: UK Could Miss 2030 Clean Power Goal, Parliament Committee Warns
content: The UK’s goal of a clean power grid by 2030 is in danger of slipping out of reach as planning delays and infrastructure bottlenecks challenge the government.

title: Moderna Will Test New Covid Shot Against Placebo, RFK Jr. Says
content: Moderna Inc. has agreed to do a placebo-controlled trial of its new Covid vaccine that was recently approved by US regulators, Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said Tuesday.

title: Trump Revokes Biden-Era Rule on Emergency Abortions in Hospitals
content: The Trump administration rescinded guidance put in place by former President Joe Biden that directed US hospitals to provide abortions on an emergency basis when they’re medically necessary to stabilize patients.

title: Westpac Says Reaches Pact With Regulator Over Mortgage Breaches
content: Westpac Banking Corp. said its RAMS Financial Group Pty. unit reached an agreement with Australia’s markets regulator to resolve its investigation into mortgages.

title: Wells Fargo Asset Cap Lifted by Fed, Paving Way for Growth
content: Wells Fargo & Co. finally escaped a Federal Reserve asset cap that has restricted its size for more than seven years, unleashing the firm from the unprecedented punishment in a major win for Chief Executive Officer Charlie Scharf. The bank’s shares surged.

title: Data Centers Added $9.4 Billion in Costs on Biggest US Grid
content: The rapid development of data centers connected to the largest US electric grid raised costs by $9.4 billion, an expense that consumers from Illinois to Washington, D.C., will see reflected in their utility bills starting this month.

title: Alberta Fire Threat Stabilizes as Rain Slows Blazes’ Growth
content: Alberta’s wildfire threat stabilized as rain slowed the growth of some blazes and one oil sands operator resumed operation after shutting down last week.

title: AMC Theaters to Run Even More Commercials Before Movies Play
content: AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. has agreed to run more advertising in its theaters, ending its yearslong opposition to commercials that come right before each movie.

title: Cash Is Key Trump Trade for $96 Billion Australian Pension Fund
content: One of Australia’s largest pension funds, UniSuper, is ramping up its cash holdings to near Covid 19-era levels as President Donald Trump’s trade war roils global markets.

title: For Toyota, More Akio Would Be a Good Thing
content: The $33 billion buyout of Toyota Industries may be a power play by former Toyota CEO Akio Toyoda. If so, skeptical investors should welcome his involvement.

title: Volkswagen Says 20,000 Workers Agree to Early Departures
content: Volkswagen AG said about 20,000 employees will voluntarily leave the company by the end of the decade as the carmaker restructures its German operations to cope with uneven demand for its vehicles.

title: Dollar General Jumps Most on Record After Raising Forecast
content: Dollar General Corp. surged after increasing its annual guidance, helped by luring more higher-income shoppers looking for deals. The discount chain also said it expects to mitigate a significant amount of the tariffs currently in place.

title: San Francisco’s New Mayor Woos the Rich to Revive Battered City
content: Daniel Lurie enlists business titans and his wealthy friends to pull the tech hub out of its post-Covid slump — and restore its reputation.

title: Balyasny Taps Ex-Deutsche Bank Basis Trader Jamie Mansell
content: Balyasny Asset Management has hired Jamie Mansell, who was co-head of European government bond trading at Deutsche Bank AG until recently, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: SpaceX 2025 Revenue Is Around $15.5 Billion, Musk Says
content: SpaceX’s revenue is projected to be around $15.5 billion in 2025, the rocket and satellite company’s chief executive officer Elon Musk wrote in a post on X on Tuesday.

title: Citi Ends Gun-Sales Policy Implemented After Florida School Shooting
content: Citigroup Inc. ended a seven-year policy that placed restrictions on firearms sales by its retail sector clients, citing recent legislative developments and concerns over access to banking services.

title: Santander Reconsiders Accounting Hire Accused of Fraud by Itau
content: Banco Santander SA is exploring whether to replace its incoming chief accounting officer as a legal case linked to the executive’s previous job winds it way through Brazil’s courts, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Paraguay Pitches Argentina, Brazil on Natural Gas Pipeline Plan
content: Paraguay is lobbying Argentina and Brazil to sign agreements signaling their political support for a proposed natural gas pipeline linking the three countries, according to a senior official in the landlocked South American nation.

title: Doritos, M&Ms Could Be Forced to Include Warnings in Texas
content: A Texas bill on the verge of becoming law would require labels on packaged food from Skittles to Mountain Dew that warn about ingredients “not recommended for human consumption” by other countries.

title: Bank of Ghana Plans to Cap Non-Performing Loan Ratio at 10% by December 2026
content: Ghana’s central bank is planning to introduce a cap on non-performing loans for the banking industry to restore asset quality after the West African nation’s debt restructuring and period of high inflation eroded individuals and companies’ ability to repay their loans.

title: Moelis Hires HSBC Business Services Dealmaker Milano
content: Boutique investment bank Moelis & Co. is hiring HSBC Holdings Plc business services banker Mark Milano for a senior role in London, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Citi’s Burke Nominated for Key US Treasury Job on Sanctions
content: Jonathan Burke, a Citigroup Inc. managing director, was nominated for one of the top US Treasury Department jobs involved in crafting sanctions policy.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023
content: Since 2023, 259 new unicorns have joined The Crunchbase Unicorn Board, adding $605 billion in total value and altogether raising $130 billion, Crunchbase data shows. We take a look at who's leading new investments.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.
